title: Drawing, "Fame with Trumpet, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: On either side of central candelabrum, flying Fame holding garland in one hand and blowing trumpet with other. Ruled chalk lines in black chalk suggest square molding.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Fame with Trumpet, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome", 1812.
1812. Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3069.
